fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a DocumentReference resource"

fields.name: masterIdentifier
fields.descr: "Document identifier as assigned by the source of the document. This identifier is specific to this version of the document. This unique identifier may be used elsewhere to identify this version of the document."

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Other identifiers associated with the document, including version independent identifiers."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "The status of this document reference."

fields.name: docStatus
fields.descr: "The status of the underlying document."

fields.name: type
fields.descr: "Specifies the particular kind of document referenced  (e.g. History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Progress Note). This usually equates to the purpose of making the document referenced."

fields.name: FHIRclass
fields.descr: "A categorization for the type of document referenced - helps for indexing and searching. This may be implied by or derived from the code specified in the DocumentReference.type."

fields.name: subject
fields.descr: "Who or what the document is about. The document can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (e.g. a machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of farm animals, or a set of patients that share a common exposure)."

fields.name: created
fields.descr: "When the document was created."

fields.name: indexed
fields.descr: "When the document reference was created."

fields.name: author
fields.descr: "Identifies who is responsible for adding the information to the document."

fields.name: authenticator
fields.descr: "Which person or organization authenticates that this document is valid."

fields.name: custodian
fields.descr: "Identifies the organization or group who is responsible for ongoing maintenance of and access to the document."

fields.name: relatesTo
fields.descr: "Relationships that this document has with other document references that already exist."

fields.name: description
fields.descr: "Human-readable description of the source document. This is sometimes known as the \"title\"."

fields.name: securityLabel
fields.descr: "A set of Security-Tag codes specifying the level of privacy/security of the Document. Note that DocumentReference.meta.security contains the security labels of the \"reference\" to the document, while DocumentReference.securityLabel contains a snapshot of the security labels on the document the reference refers to."

fields.name: content
fields.descr: "The document and format referenced. There may be multiple content element repetitions, each with a different format."

fields.name: context
fields.descr: "The clinical context in which the document was prepared."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: meta
fields.descr:
"The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: implicitRules
fields.descr:
"A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: language
fields.descr:
"The base language in which the resource is written."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

searches.name: encounter
searches.descr:
Multiple Resources: 

* [DocumentReference](documentreference.html): Context of the document  content
* [RiskAssessment](riskassessment.html): Where was assessment performed?
* [DeviceRequest](devicerequest.html): Encounter or Episode during which request was created
* [Procedure](procedure.html): Search by encounter
* [List](list.html): Context in which list created
* [VisionPrescription](visionprescription.html): Return prescriptions with this encounter identifier
* [ProcedureRequest](procedurerequest.html): An encounter in which this request is made
* [Flag](flag.html): Alert relevant during encounter
* [Observation](observation.html): Encounter related to the observation
* [DiagnosticReport](diagnosticreport.html): The Encounter when the order was made
* [NutritionOrder](nutritionorder.html): Return nutrition orders with this encounter identifier
* [Composition](composition.html): Context of the Composition
searches.expression: DocumentReference.context.encounter | RiskAssessment.context | DeviceRequest.context | Procedure.context | List.encounter | VisionPrescription.encounter | ProcedureRequest.context | Flag.encounter | Observation.context | DiagnosticReport.context | NutritionOrder.encounter | Composition.encounter
searches.xpath: context/encounter | RiskAssessment/context | DeviceRequest/context | Procedure/context | List/encounter | VisionPrescription/encounter | ProcedureRequest/context | Flag/encounter | Observation/context | DiagnosticReport/context | NutritionOrder/encounter | Composition/encounter

searches.name: author
searches.descr: Who and/or what authored the document

searches.name: facility
searches.descr: Kind of facility where patient was seen

searches.name: indexed
searches.descr: When this document reference was created

searches.name: location
searches.descr: Uri where the data can be found

searches.name: period
searches.descr: Time of service that is being documented

searches.name: relatedid
searches.descr: Identifier of related objects or events

searches.name: setting
searches.descr: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)

searches.name: subject
searches.descr: Who/what is the subject of the document
